Key Arguments: The legislation erodes freedom of speech and information.
Information should be judged by individuals, not regulated by the government.
The legislation could silence dissenting voices and enforce a single government-approved narrative.
Speech and information are not inherently harmful.
The legislation could lead to social fallout and danger for citizens it aims to protect.
Unpopular ideas could be legally censored.
Notable Quotes: There will literally no longer be any freedom of speech, ideas, communication or ideology.
Unpopular ideas could be legally censored.
Please give some credit to the ability of people to discern and decide for themselves what is true and what is not.
